entry.title: [omnibox][webui] Fixes Action selection + simplifications
entry.content:
Actions can be selected in the WebUI Omnibox Popup via tab navigation

in the omnibox input, albeit the focus indicator is not updated

accordingly. However, Actions cannot be selected via mouse click.



In the former case, OmniboxEditModel keeps track of the popup selection.

In the latter case the popup selection is synthesized in RealboxHandler

and communicated to OmniboxEditModel. However RealboxHandler always

creates its own instance of the ACController which is different from the

instance owned by the OmniboxEditModel which powers the Omnibox.



This CL makes the RealboxHandler use the same OmniboxController - and

thus the same OmniboxEditModel and ACController instances - as the

omnibox when being used in the context of the WebUI omnibox popup.



Additionally, this CL makes a bunch of code simplifications such as

unifying the mojom Page interface between the realbox and omnibox popup,

eliminating the use of AutocompleteControllerEmitter in favor of direct

observation of ACController, and removing unused variables.



Bug: 1442068

entry.title: [SmartLock] Cleanup profile pref manager
entry.content:
Now that Signin with Smart Lock is deprecated, there's no need for any

Smart Lock-related local state prefs. This CL simplifies the

ProximityAuthProfilePrefManager given that it no longer needs to observe

multidevice feature states and sync with the local state. Unlock with

Smart Lock is unchanged.



TEST=existing unittests pass, manually tested Smart Lock with pixel4a

and strongbad.

entry.title: chromeos: Applied MNext styles to status area
entry.content:
This CL applied the following changes to the status area:

1) Removed the InkDrop for TrayBackgroundView if Jelly is enabled.

2) Changed the background color if TrayBackgroundView is active.

3) Updated the TrayItemView color for active and inactive state.

4) Updated every tray item in the UnifiedSystemTray, DateTray, and

NotificationCenterTray to have the active/inactive state with the new

Jelly color.

entry.title: [Lacros a11y] Creates skeleton EmbeddedA11yManagerLacros
entry.content:
Select to Speak and Switch Access both inject a content script into

Google Docs that informs Docs to annotate the canvas for a11y. This

script was not injected in Lacros browsers because STS/Switch run as

component extension in Ash.



ChromeVox injects a content script to Google Docs that informs Docs

that the screen reader is on. Similarly, this was not injected in Lacros

browsers because ChromeVox runs as a component extension in Ash.



This change creates EmbeddedA11yManagerLacros which will listen for

Select to Speak, ChromeVox and Switch Access changes and in a follow-up

will stand up helper component extensions in Lacros that do the

content script injection.



This change also modifies the TestController API such that it can

turn on and off accessibility features without side effects.



For a more end-to-end prototype, see crrev.com/c/4569470.

For high-level design and motivation, see

go/lacros-embedded-a11y-extensions.

entry.title: Color Pipeline: Allow applying CSS variables on a shadow root
entry.content:
This CL adds a param to the colors.css endpoint that outputs CSS that

applies the color pipeline CSS variables on a shadow root (:host)

instead of on the element. This allows WebUI components to

use the color pipeline without requiring its parent HTML file to.



This is useful in cases like the IPH bubble where we want the bubble to

be themed but the host WebUI page (eg. Password Manager) may not be

ready to be themed yet.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Add DevTools support for FencedFrameReporter beacons
entry.content:
Reporting beacons can be triggered by fenced frames and asynchronously

sent through FencedFrameReporter. This CL makes DevTools aware of these

requests.



Currently, FencedFrameReporter should only exist when the fenced frame

exists, but this may not always be the case (e.g., if we want to

prevent beacons from being lost due to races). To make DevTools

integration future-proof, we store the initiator's frame tree node id

and then retrieve the frame tree node asynchronously, when the request

starts. If the frame tree node doesn't exist at that point, we skip

registering the request with DevTools. This means the support is only

best-effort but always safe.



Bug: 1424853

Change-Id: Id4380464f43ad35f65d611457516051ff5e65527

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4395189

entry.title: Add unit tests for FontSizeAdjust.
entry.content:
This change adds unit tests to verify the public APIs of FontSizeAdjust.

The tests examine the support of the two-value syntax of

font-size-adjust, which is newly introduced in CSS Font Module Level 5.

In addition, this change makes FontSizeAdjust::ToString truncate

trailing zeros if the return value is a floating number.

entry.title: Make the rust host build tools toolchain use real host cpu on Windows
entry.content:
On Windows, when compiling for x86, the host_toolchain is set to be x86

as well. This makes C++ targets for the host_toolchain be built

targeting x86. The reason given in the BUILDCONFIG.gn file is to avoid

compiling things for both host and target when x86 things run fine on

x64.



(It's not clear to me what would end up being built for both host and

target but anyway..)



The rust host build tools toolchain only builds Rusty things like proc

macros and build scripts which are used with the host compiler to build

stuff for the target platform. The targets use a prebuilt stdlib (and

to do otherwise needs a.. prebuilt stdlib to build the stdlib..) which

only exists for the real host platform. It is very hard to get the

rust toolchain build to produce stdlib binaries for both x86 and x64

given how paths to libraries come from the environment.



So we break ways with the C++ host_toolchain and in the rust host

build tools toolchain, we set the cpu to always be the host_cpu on

Windows.



One change that was needed then is to move the setting of the

/MACHINE command line argument into the toolchain itself where the

final cpu is known.



Bug: 1448334



Change-Id: If8b6c4a372f1d217e5c059a9d96ccc1cf15aa9e5

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:android-rust-arm32-rel,android-rust-arm64-dbg,android-rust-arm64-rel,linux-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,mac-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-rel

entry.title: [DB] Add flag to allow skipping the triggering criteria
entry.content:
This adds a new flag to allow users to skip triggering criteria.

There are two options to force display a default browser promo:

Option 1:

- Select the promo to enable #default-browser-promo-force-show-promo

- Enable #promos-manager-uses-fet

- Enable IPH_iOSPromoDefaultBrowser on #in-product-help-demo-mode-choice



Option 2:

- Select the promo to enable #default-browser-promo-force-show-promo

- Disable #promos-manager-uses-fet

- Enable Force Promo "Default Browser" in the system settings experimental flag.

entry.title: Revert "Multiplanar: Plumb color space through D3D11TextureWrapper"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 974d24939fdd9ea28e480bdda56f03ab2833a225.



Reason for revert: Crash reports and FYI failures https://crbug.com/1451013



Original change's description:

> Multiplanar: Plumb color space through D3D11TextureWrapper

>

> This change plumbs the video frame color space to D3D11TextureWrapper

> where it is used for creating a shared image. This is needed for

> multiplanar shared images where the color space within the shared image

> is used to create skia images and then perform a YUV to RGB conversion

> within RasterDecoder through a skia blit instead of earlier plumbing

> the video frame color space to perform conversion through another

> method.

>

> Here, the color space is passed from the D3D11 video decoder which

> also clears the picture buffers, recreating pictures and shared images

> on a color space change trigger. The color space is then passed through

> the texture selector to wrapper where it is stored and used for

> creating shared images later.

>

> Bug: 1444189

> Change-Id: Ic69bb2adfce99ef974b80d25b4937a38db7d898d

> Reviewed-by: Dan Sanders

> Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

> Commit-Queue: Saifuddin Hitawala

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152192}

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Reland "[rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust"""
entry.content:
This reverts commit f15db1f44786bdf1792e6c82d1287a4dafb18ea0.



Reason for revert: Breaks Linux 32bit bot again https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chromium/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8779368853094493105/+/u/compile/stdout#L35226_1



Original change's description:

> Reland "Reland "[rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust""

>

> This is a reland of commit ea7942caa3af0be58837ff11a06e8d1b0defd4eb

>

> Reland because we are now providing the host i686 Rust stdlib

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reland "[rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust"

> >

> > This is a reland of commit 8cc6a95b1489275e5040f7e619d2d6faa826f984

> >

> > Reason for reland:

> > CFI bot problem fixed by

> > https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577764

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > [rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust

> > >

> > > This enables some bytes of Rust in the real Chromium executable for the

> > > first time. Those bytes are a handler for chrome://crash/rust URIs, and

> > > thus no Rust will be executed by normal Chrome users. This gives us a

> > > low-risk opportunity to discover any implications of Rust within Chrome

> > > and gives us a chance to test out Rust's crash handling.

> > >

> > > For now, we're enabling this only on Android and Linux - this condition

> > > will be relaxed in future.

> > >

> > > Bug: 1292038, 1368726

> > > Change-Id: Ia648ee4b3c104d67bed3d7444325453bc7b865ab

> > > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4386637

> > > Commit-Queue: Adrian Taylor

> > > Reviewed-by: ukasz Anforowicz

> > > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1151428}

> >

> > Bug: 1292038, 1368726

> > Change-Id: Ife9cb3741c47f310241844bf0e2bf597fad06324

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577199

entry.title: [ios] Fix KeyCommandsProviderTest flake
entry.content:
The TwoScreensSigninCoordinator was not properly dismissing its

navigation controller in cases where it was interrupted by code. This

left some state that caused KeyCommandsProviderTest

CanPerform_EditingTextActions to fail on iOS 15. This change dismisses

the navigation controller without animation in cases where it is

interrupted like this.



Fixed: 1450826

entry.title: Fix "Google Password Manager" link contrast in Save dialog.
entry.content:
When you are signed in and syncing code, when you type in

a password, the password manager pops up a dialog to ask

if you want to save the password. In the footer of that

dialog there is a link for more information on Google

Password Manager. The link is displayed on a light grey

background, and didn't have enough contrast to be

properly readable. This change fixes that.

entry.title: quick-settings:Crash-fix for rotation tile
entry.content:
The RotationLockFeaturePodController observes rotation lock

changes. A side effect of this is that tablet mode transitions

can trigger tile updates, even though the tile that is being updated

will soon get destroyed.



The root issue is that when the rotation lock feature pod shows

alongside another compact pod, hiding the feature pod can result in

attempting to show an invalid QuickSettingsView layout, which hits

a DCHECK.



The UnifiedQuickSettingsBubble actually closes for tablet mode

transitions, so a fix for this is to not react to tablet mode transitions.



Bug: b:272747756

Change-Id: I0a538eeb9f486146818b00d449d16dcc24fbc272

entry.title: [omnibox] Scraps OmniboxEditModelDelegate and subclasses
entry.content:
OmniboxEditModelDelegate - previously known as OmniboxEditController -

is an interface for providing information about the current page, the

navigation entry, and the omnibox input by the embedder to the omnibox

component code.



Similarly, OmniboxClient is an interface that allows the omnibox

component to interact with its embedder for things like getting

information about the current page and retrieving instances associated

with the current page or the profile.



Much of the APIs in OmniboxEditModelDelegate is not implemented by any

of its concrete subclasses besides the Desktop specific

ChromeOmniboxEditModelDelegate. Those APIs can be moved to the

LocationBar interface which serves a similar purpose as

ChromeOmniboxEditModelDelegate and is implemented by LocationBarView

along with ChromeOmniboxEditModelDelegate. The second category of the

APIs can have a default noop implementation in OmniboxClient and

be overridden in the applicable concrete subclasses. And the remaining

APIs which have to be implemented by all embedders - e.g.,

GetLocationBarModel() - can be made pure virtual in the OmniboxClient

requiring the concrete implementations in the subclasses.



This CL eliminates the need for OmniboxEditModelDelegate by making

those changes, leaving OmniboxClient solely responsible for interaction

between the omnibox component code with the embedder.



Also adds //components/omnibox/OWNERS as an //ios/chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/OWNERS for refactorings and simple, mechanical changes.



Bug: 1404748

Change-Id: I511066f2e36a4b346f8b988e336b7d10c5a71bc6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4569308

Reviewed-by: Justin Donnelly

entry.title: Don't prevent initialization of StatusBarColorController for automotive
entry.content:
Status bar should always be black for automotive devices, so we can

prevent initialization of StatusBarColorController for automotive

devices. An attempt to do that was made in crrev.com/c/4577994. However,

this attempt did not catch the cases where StatusBarColorController was

initialized using dependency injection for Custom Tabs. Addressing this

case is not trivial, so I am rolling back parts of the initial cl and

adding a TODO: crbug/1450945.

want to make the entire extraction fail if the modified time would be

incorrect. The content is still extracted successfully, which is the

important fact. This error occurs extremely rarely, so no significant

unpacking improvements are expected due to this CL.

This is a reland of commit ea7942caa3af0be58837ff11a06e8d1b0defd4eb



Reland because we are now providing the host i686 Rust stdlib



Original change's description:

> Reland "[rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust"

>

> This is a reland of commit 8cc6a95b1489275e5040f7e619d2d6faa826f984

>

> Reason for reland:

> CFI bot problem fixed by

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577764

>

> Original change's description:

> > [rust] Enable chrome://crash/rust

> >

> > This enables some bytes of Rust in the real Chromium executable for the

> > first time. Those bytes are a handler for chrome://crash/rust URIs, and

> > thus no Rust will be executed by normal Chrome users. This gives us a

> > low-risk opportunity to discover any implications of Rust within Chrome

> > and gives us a chance to test out Rust's crash handling.

> >

> > For now, we're enabling this only on Android and Linux - this condition

> > will be relaxed in future.

entry.title: Support requesting multiple trigger verification tokens
entry.content:
Given null reports generation(https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/750), it is possible that multiple reports are

created from a single trigger.



To avoid leaking which reports are null reports and which ones are real

, we request multiple verification tokens that are then randomly

assigned to generated reports.



This CL, update the Report Verification feature to request the reporting

origin to sign multiple tokens by sending for signature a list

structured header that contains N blinded messages.



BorringSSL currently does not support batch issuance with different

messages. As a result, we instantiate N BorringSSL cryptographers and

begin N issuance per trigger.



Bug: 1435014,1440838,1440744

Change-Id: I92cb0b729c270414732985cf5776af748c5fa1a5

entry.title: Point gnrt to the cargo binary
entry.content:
We install cargo (and rust) beta into a sysroot in order to build

gnrt. However gnrt also runs Cargo, and needs to know the path to

that binary. Otherwise it requires Cargo in the path, which we don't

want to rely on.



So we add a --cargo-path arg to gnrt and specify the path from

gnrt_stdlib.py



Recently stdlib Cargo.toml files started using a nightly feature

and we need to set RUSTC_BOOTSTRAP in the environment when running

Cargo against them, so do that.



But we need to roll cargo_metadata crate to 0.15 in order to have the

env() method on CargoMetadata.



Avoid checking the stage0 signature when running

build_rust.py --update-deps

Since we are just vendoring dependencies at that point.



R=zequanwu@google.com

entry.title: Use ProducerEndpoint::Disconnect to safely disconnect system tracing
entry.content:
Currently while tracing if the system producer gets disconnected we give

up and crash chrome. However recently last year support was added to

ProducerEndpoint::Disconnect which ignored any future calls without

touching the socket which was now invalid (preventing the previous

seqfaults). This has become more and more frequent as Android has

started to freeze apps in the background and traced would disconnect us

for being unresponsive (while Chrome was frozen).



With some additional state to track we can now safely disconnect system

tracing and restore our connection once we've resumed.



I tested this manually with a script that did the following.



1) launched chrome on a webpage

2) Started a system trace and scrolled up and down and stored the PIDs

of the Chrome processes in the trace

3) Started a system trace and kill -9 traced

4) Started a system trace scrolled up and down and stored the PIDs of

the chrome processes in the trace.

5) counted how frequently 2 & 4 matched



Before this patch 100% disagreement (chrome crashed so no processes in

step 4) and 100% agreement post patch in 30 runs.



Complete test code can be found in this zip folder here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GxxhP7vbQmal6F0NCY6ihsMxYTrldb8o/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-LKbP40kqR0UJNRfaduK_Ew



Bug: b/280498612

Change-Id: I31a9791e21263642d093e53836a785f51926cfcd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4585088

Auto-Submit: Stephen Nusko

Reviewed-by: Alexander Timin

Commit-Queue: Stephen Nusko

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152676}

entry.title: Implementing synchronous Connect* methods for BrokeredUdpClientSocket
entry.content:
This change modified Connect(), ConnectUsingNetwork(), and

ConnectUsingDefaultNetwork() in BrokeredUdpClientSocket such that if

a connection does not need to be brokered, these methods create and

connect a socket. If a connection needs to be brokered, the methods

now return net::ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED.



There is currently one feature flag configuration where the

network service can be enabled, but QUIC session creation can

still be synchronous. When this configuration is enabled, session

creation calls Connect() on windows instead of ConnectAsync().

Since the original implementation did nothing and returned

net::OK this caused a crash. This change fixes that crash,

and also causes brokered sockets to fail instead of completely

crashing.



Bug: 1448725

entry.title: [iOS] Ensure AffiliationBackend gets destroyed on shutdown
entry.content:
During shutdown, AffiliationServiceImpl makes a call to

DeleteSoon destroy AffiliationBackend on the backend's task runner.

If this call fails to run before the task runner is itself

destroyed, then it doesn't run at all, meaning that the

AffiliationBackend's destructor never runs, and nor does the

destructor of the AffiliationFetchThrottler that it owns.



AffiliationFetchThrottler only removes itself as a

NetworkConnectionObserver in its destructor, so if this destructor

doesn't run, then NetworkConnectionTracker is left with an observer

that is never removed, which violates a DCHECK that the observer list

is empty in NetworkConnectionTracker's destructor.



To avoid this state, this CL makes the backend task runner have

TaskShutdownBehavior::BLOCK_SHUTDOWN, meaning that when the task

runner is destroyed, it will first finishing running its queued-up

tasks rather than ignoring them, ensuring that the DeleteSoon task

executes.



Bug: 1450406

Change-Id: I34a541a7b46d525c60faffeffa9801eb85bd774a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4582327

entry.title: [cc] Post another delayed flush task in ReclaimResources() in bg
entry.content:
When LayerTreeHostImpl::ReclaimResources() is called in background (for

instance when the compositor frame is evicted, deleting the viz Surface,

returning all resources), we've added a flush to make sure that the

resource release delayed tasks actually make it to the GPU process.



However, there are cases where the delayed task is not immediately

queued from ReclaimResources(), but from another task. This is the case

at least for TextureLayer, which is used for . In thie case,

post another flush task 1s later, to leave enough time for these tasks

to run.



Bug: 1449271

entry.title: Alt-double-click on link causes text selection.
entry.content:
Now the bug is fixed



What steps will reproduce the problem?

(1) Hover over any hyperlink.

(2) Press alt + double_click.



What is the expected result?

Selection of word.



What happens instead?

Download a hyperlink file and selection of word



Solution:

The mouse_event (click_count == 1 && alt_pressed && mouse_up)

(this event starts download of file)

now held until the next click times out (500 ms).

If the next click occurs, the held event will be destroyed,

otherwise the event will be dispatched.



Bug: 1428816

Change-Id: I12f41bafa4e356a1f75d2e5d4981d948513c826d
